newsitem.title: USA: Mecklenburg Cty, N.C., plans $500 mln bond vote.
newsitem.headline: Mecklenburg Cty, N.C., plans $500 mln bond vote.

text.p: North Carolina's Mecklenburg County Commission tentatively approved a November referendum on a $500 million general obligation bond proposal, the Charlotte Observer said Thursday.
The bulk of the bonds, $415 million, would finance school construction and renovation. About $62 million would fund jail expansion and $23 million would fund projects at Central Piedmont College.
The bond proposal was part of a $942 million budget tentatively approved by the commission. The budget and the bond proposal are expected to win final approval next week, the newspaper said.
